intro: Persoonia marginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geebung, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces woody fruit capsules that release seeds when mature. Persoonia marginata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native wildlife.
